brown.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: having the colour of earth, wood, or coffee
brown.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: having skin that has been turned brown by the sun
brown.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He’d been on vacation and looked very brown.
He was as brown as a berry after two weeks in the sun.
brown.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Cook until the cheese is golden brown.
It was autumn and the leaves were already rusty brown.
the muddy brown water of the river
He was wearing a chocolate brown pullover.
brown.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the colour of earth, wood, or coffee
brown.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: This particular model is available in brown, white, or grey.
the browns and greens of the landscape
brown.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to heat food so that it turns brown, or to become brown by being heated
brown.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: First, brown the meat in a pan.
brown.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to become brown because of the sun’s heat, or to make something brown in this way
brown.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The children’s faces were browned by the sun.
